com.ibm.watson.dsm.util

Class AbstractClientServer<LISTENER,DYN_DATA,STATIC_DATA>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ibm.watson.dsm.util.AbstractKeyedListenerManager<AbstractClientServer<LISTENER,DYN_DATA,STATIC_DATA>,LISTENER,DYN_DATA,STATIC_DATA,java.lang.Object>
      • com.ibm.watson.dsm.util.AbstractClientServer<LISTENER,DYN_DATA,STATIC_DATA>
  • Type Parameters:
    LISTENER - The listener interface that users register as listeners via AbstractKeyedListenerManager.addListener(Object, Object, Object).
    DYN_DATA - The dynamic data provided to #notifyListeners(Object, Object) and which will be passed to the listener.
    STATIC_DATA - The static data provided to AbstractKeyedListenerManager.removeListener(Object, Object, Object) and which will be passed to the listener.

    public abstract class AbstractClientServer<LISTENER,DYN_DATA,STATIC_DATA>
extends AbstractKeyedListenerManager<AbstractClientServer<LISTENER,DYN_DATA,STATIC_DATA>,LISTENER,DYN_DATA,STATIC_DATA,java.lang.Object>
    Provides framework for both a client and server thread to be created to exchange messages with other instances of this class running in another JVM. Subclasses must implement
    • #getReceiverSocket() - get a socket which is used to receive packets from the sender socket.
    • getSenderSocket() - get the socket used to send packets to the receiver socket.
    • getOutboundPacketData() - gets the data to be sent by the sender
    • packetDataToObject(byte[], int) - converts a received packet into a Java object.
    • processPacketData(Object) - defines the action to take on received Java objects.
    to define the actual sending and receiving of messages and to call the listener interface-specific method. The instance's threads are initialized and started with a call to start() and stopped with stop().

    The class is a generic type to allow for precise typing of the listeners that can be installed here. Listeners are called when new data is received in receiverThread() using #notifyListeners(Object, Object).

    Author:
    dawood

                    int destPort,
                    java.lang.String receivingAddress,
                    int receivingPort,
                    int sendInterval,
                    java.util.List<java.net.InetAddress> multicastAddresses,
                    com.ibm.watson.pml.util.ComponentLogger logger)
        Parameters:
        destAddress - multicast address to send multicast messages
        destPort - port to send multicast messages to.
        receivingAddress - passed to getReceiverSocket().
        receivingPort - passed to getReceiverSocket()
        sendInterval - how often, in milliseconds, to send multicast packagets, on average.
        multicastAddresses - list of addresses from which to send multicast traffic, if getSenderSocket() returns a MulticastSocket.
        logger -

        protected abstract DYN_DATA packetDataToObject(byte[] packetData,
                          int length)
                                        throws java.io.IOException
        Convert a received packet of data to a Java Object.
        Parameters:
        packetData -
        length -
        Returns:
        may be null, in which case the packetData is ignored.
        Throws:
        EOFException - if the given packet is incomplete. In this case, the receiverThread() will increase the size of the receiver buffer to try and get all the data.
        java.io.IOException

      • processPacketData

        protected abstract void processPacketData(DYN_DATA msg)
        Implemented by subclasses to do what is desired with the data received by receiverThread().
        Parameters:
        msg -

      • senderThread

        protected void senderThread()
        This is called within its own thread and is responsible for sending messages to other instances listening for messages in receiverThread().

        Creates a socket using getSenderSocket() and sends packets until stop() is called. It loops on sending packets filled with the bytes from getOutboundPacketData() to the socket.

      • sendSoon

        protected void sendSoon()
        Cause the sending of the next packet as soon as possible.

      • start

        public void start()
           throws java.net.UnknownHostException,
                  DSMException
        Start the receiver and sender threads and arrange for them to execute receiverThread() and senderThread(), respectively.
        Throws:
        java.net.UnknownHostException
        DSMException
        DSMException

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Cause the sender and receiver threads to terminate gracefully.

      • closeReceiverSocket

        protected void closeReceiverSocket()
        Closes the receiver socket. Subclasses may override if they need to do some other clean ups before calling this to close the socket.

      • isStarted

        public boolean isStarted()
        See if the start() method was the most recently called of start() and stop() and checks to be sure both threads are alive.
        Returns:

      • getReceiverSocket

        protected abstract java.net.DatagramSocket getReceiverSocket(java.lang.String receiverAddress,
                                        int receiverPort)
        Get a socket that is bound to the given address and port according to their values.
        Parameters:
        receiverAddress - if not null, then don't bind to an address. This is the same value that is provided to the constructor.
        receiverPort - port to listen on, if greater than 0, otherwise all ports.
        Returns:
        null on error.

      • getSenderSocket

        protected abstract java.net.DatagramSocket getSenderSocket()
        Get a socket to use to send data out on. The socket will be used to pass data to destAddress and destPort.
        Returns:

      • getOutboundPacketData

        protected abstract byte[] getOutboundPacketData()
        Get the data to be sent to the receiver. The length of the array should not be larger than .
        Returns:
        may be null, but not sure why you'ld want to do that.

      • receiverThread

        protected void receiverThread()
        This is called within its own thread and is responsible for receiving messages from other instances' calls from senderThread(). When messages are received, they should be passed to #notifyListeners(Object, Object).

        Creates a receiving socket on the configured address and port and receives packets until terminated by stop() Every packet received is converted to a Java object using packetDataToObject(byte[], int). If a non-null object is returned, then it is passed to processPacketData(Object) and #notifyListeners(Object, Object).
